sentences.en: But he has pledged to repeal many of the tax cuts enacted by President Bush.
sentences.cn: 但他又保证会废除布什总统颁布的减税法案.

sentences.en: Despite continued efforts to repeal this act, federal courts have upheld its major provisions.
sentences.cn: 尽管有人不断努力以图撤消这项法律, 联邦法院始终坚持执行这项法律中的主要条款.

sentences.en: Harry has made out a strong case for the repeal of the Corn Laws.
sentences.cn: 哈里提出强有力的理由,赞成废除《玉米法案》.

sentences.en: He has made out a strong case for the repeal of the law.
sentences.cn: 他提出强有力的理由,赞成废除该法令.

sentences.en: Many voted for the repeal of that property law.
sentences.cn: 许多人投票赞成废止那项财产法.

sentences.en: Next year will be the 60th anniversary of the repeal of Prohibition.
sentences.cn: 明年将是禁酒令废除60周年。

sentences.en: Pay: With your square for the income person's confirm of, can't repeal timeletter of credit pay.
sentences.cn: 支付: 以你方为收益人保兑的 、 不可撤消的即期信用证支付.

sentences.en: Perhaps, as with other challenged orthodoxies, there is a case for revision not repeal.
sentences.cn: 或许, 正如其它受到挑战的正统理论一样, 调整而不是废除这个理论是有理由的.

sentences.en: Says he would repeal the Defense of Marriage Act and voted against the Federal Marriage Amendment.
sentences.cn: 说他将废除婚姻保护法案,但曾投票反对联邦婚姻修正案.

sentences.en: Some initiatives propose the repeal of existing state laws.
sentences.cn: 一些倡议建议废除现有的州法律.

sentences.en: The bill seek to repeal the existing legislation.
sentences.cn: 该议案企图废除现存的有关立法.

sentences.en: The Congress decided to repeal the law.
sentences.cn: 议会决定废除那项法令.

sentences.en: The government has just repealed the law segregating public facilities.
sentences.cn: 政府刚刚废除了隔离公共设施的法令。

sentences.en: There are moves in Congress to repeal or defer the EPA's power to regulate greenhouse gases.
sentences.cn: 国会也有关于废止抑或是服从环境保护机构管理温室气体权力的行动.

sentences.en: They wanted to repeal all the legislation that imposed economic controls.
sentences.cn: 他们想要取消所有的经济管制立法.

sentences.en: To enact, amend or repeal laws, examine and approve budgets, approve taxation and public expenditure etc.
sentences.cn: 制定 、 修改和废除法律, 审核、通过财政预算, 批准税收和公共开支等.

trans.tran_cn: 废除；撤销；废止；放弃；否定
trans.tran_en: if a government repeals a law, it officially ends that law
